Articles.Content:
Zaltonic Electronics has come to you in order to promote their amazingly powerful and dependable Z-100 battery pack. They have told you they want to demonstrate it by powering an airliner with it. You told them that airliner batteries aren't for powering the engines. They told you that was a matter of opinion.

Your goal is to get as many Kerbals from the runway to the Island runway as you can using a single Z-100 has your only energy source.

No losing parts or putting passengers in lawn chairs.

My entry: the Lawnmower Airlines 01
11 Kerbals to the Island runway on 78.07 units of electricity.
It is powered by two of the smallest electric motors with a motor size of 4% each, meaning it consumes just 0.13 units of charge per second. Based on the torque specs, each engine is 52 Horsepower at max RPM. However, the actual acceleration of the plane seems to violate energy conservation. Its kinetic energy increases much more rapidly than 10 W/kg (30% the power/weight of the Wright flyer!) should allow. I suspect this conservation of energy violation is a function of KSP's nonsensical prop blade physics.








Edited July 16, 2019 by Pds314
